chargeHist.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
All charges against James Paul Adducci in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James Paul Adducci is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Paul Adducci

records.addlTxt: Jury selection on October 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:08 am   Defendant James Paul Adducci in court.  Attorney Danielle Kranz in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Court:  Are you going to hire an atty or are you going to apply for a PD?  Adducci:  I'm going to represent myself.   Court discusses proceeding without counsel and that it could put him at a great disadvantage.  Adducci:  I talked to an atty that represented me before and he feld the charges should be dropped.  At this time, I've considered everything and am going to represent myself.  Court:  If you've talked to that atty., why wouldn't you have him represent you?   I've talked to him continuously and it's also financial.....  Court:  Are you working right now?  Adducci:  No.  Court:  You would probably qualify for a PD if you're not working.  Adducci:  I understand.  Technically, I'm self employed but the income is not there due to Covid.  Court:  I would give you an opportunity to get a lawyer.  Adducci:  With all due respect, I will represent myself.
Court:  We'll recall your case in a little bit.
11:31 am   Case recalled - same appearances.
Court:  So Mr. Adducci, you've now just witnessed testimony on a PH.   Do you now want an atty.?  Adducci:  No.  I'll proceed without counsel.  Court addresses Mr. Adducci again about proceeding without counsel.  Finds Mr. Adducci F, V & I waives his right to an atty..
11:33 am  ALEXANDRA BEARDMORE sworn/testify - Patrol officer with the City of La Crosse PD.
11:44 am  Witness excused
State rests.
Adducci states he has documents he's submitted to the DA's Ofc.  Addresses documents and argues against PC.
PROBABLE CAUSE FOUND - BOUND OVER FOR TRIAL
INFORMATION FILED - COPY GIVEN TO DEF
NG PLEAS ENTERED
